intro: Satureja adamovicii, commonly known as Armenian savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple or pink. Its leaves are fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja adamovicii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and antimicrobial properties.
